{{Infobox figure skater |name= Trifun Zivanovic |image= |caption= |country= [[Serbia]] |formercountry = [[Serbia and Montenegro]]
[[Yugoslavia]]
[[United States]] |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1975|4|17}} |residence= |height= {{convert|165|cm|ft|abbr=on}} |coach= [[Gary Visconti]] |formercoach= [[Mingzhu Li]], [[Hans MÃ¼ller (figure skater)|Hans MÃ¼ller]],http://pagesperso-orange.fr/planetepatinage/biographies/serbie/zivanovic_trifun.htm [[Ada Minevich]] |choreographer= [[Natalia Dubova]] |skating club= Ice Integra Belgrade |retired= |combined total= 170.62 |combined date= [[2003 Skate America]] |SP score= 58.75 |SP date= [[2003 Skate America]] |FS score= 111.87 |FS date= [[2003 Skate America]] }} '''Trifun Zivanovic''' (born on April 17, 1975 in [[Santa Monica, CA]]) is an American-born [[Serb]]ian [[figure skater]]. Born in the United States, Zivanovic competes internationally for Serbia. ==Career== Through [[2001]], he competed for the [[United States]], twice capturing medals at the [[U.S. Figure Skating Championships]]. After 2001, he represented [[Yugoslavia]], his father's native country. He competed in the [[2006 Winter Olympics]] representing Serbia and Montenegro. Following the break-up of that country, Zivanovic competed for Serbia. To qualify for the 2006 Olympics, Zivanovic needed to place in the top 24 at the 2005 [[World Figure Skating Championships]]. After failing to do that, he had another shot at qualifying by placing in the top six at the [[Karl Shafer Memorial]]. He placed ninth, but made the Olympic team after several skaters who qualified ahead of him had to withdraw.http://ww2.nwherald.com/pdf/olympics/zivanovic.html Zivanovic has the distinction of having competed at the [[World Figure Skating Championships]] representing four countries: the United States, Yugoslavia, Serbia and Montenegro, and Serbia. He is also one of the few skaters to have competed at both the [[Four Continents Figure Skating Championships]] and the [[European Figure Skating Championships]]. He is the first male singles skater to have competed at every senior-level ISU Championships.[http://www.skatetoday.com/articles0405/022005.htm Skate Today : Zivanovic Makes History for Serbia] Zivanovic works as an ice skating instructor at [http://www.pickwickgardens.com Pickwick Ice Center] in [[Burbank, California]]. ==Competitive highlights== (for Yugoslavia/Serbia and Montenegro/Serbia) {| class="wikitable" |- !
